title: Bertie Plays the Blues
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Paysage Moralisé For Bertie Pollock, Saturday brought few surprises. The  day began, as Saturdays always did, with a walk to Valvona  & Crolla with his mother and Ulysses, his younger brother,  whose pushchair Bertie was allowed to propel along  London Street as far as the Broughton Street roundabout. Then his mother took over for the ascent towards Albany  Street.

title: Bertie Plays the Blues
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: "One's journey  is easy at the beginning but becomes more arduous as time  goes by. Thus Drummond Place and London Street are not  particularly challenging, but then one encounters Broughton  Street and it becomes more taxing. It is exactly the same  with life: it's simple at the beginning, Bertie, but it gets  steadily more complex."

title: The Careful Use of Compliments
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: They kissed, and she watched him for a few moments as he walked down Broughton Street. He must have sensed her gaze, as he turned round and waved to her before continuing.

title: The Careful Use of Compliments
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Jamie followed her out of the saleroom and out on to Broughton Street. He looked at his watch; he had to be at the Edinburgh Academy in half an hour to give a lesson.

title: Memoir of Robert Chambers /
author: Chambers, William
snippet: It was now that Robert, as will be afterwards stated in his own words, became known to Sir Walter Scott, by writing for him and presenting, through Mr Constable, a transcript of the songs of the Lady of the Lake, in the small and neat style of caligraphy to which I have made some reference. Immediately afterwards, in 1822, he removed to India Place; I removed to Broughton Street in the spring of 1823 ; both places, as we diffidently ventured to hope, being intermediate to something better.

title: Crime
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: And Ray Lennox – gaunt, white-faced, clean-shaven, his trademark  floppy fringe shorn at John's in Broughton Street to reveal a short, sloping forehead – feels his pulse precipitously quicken.

title: The Careful Use of Compliments
author: McCall Smith, Alexander
snippet: Isabel looked up at the sky, which was clear but for a few scudding clouds, wispy, high-level streaks of white. 'It's so bright,' she said, shivering as a gust of wind swept up Broughton Street and penetrated the thin layer of her jersey.

title: The journal of Sir Walter Scott,
author: Scott, Walter
snippet: Recommends the wild mustard as an aperient. But the brightest ray of hope is the chance that I may get some mechanical aid made by Fortune at Broughton Street, which may enable me to mount a'pony with ease, and to walk without torture. This would, indeed, be almost a restoration of my youth, at least of a green old age full of enjoyment.

title: Skagboys
author: Welsh, Irvine
snippet: pub in Broughton Street afterwards, Kev Stewart,
